scenes.text: Why does everything feel expensive now?
scenes.subtext: A systems view of price inflation in daily life.

scenes.text: Step 1: Demand rises faster than supply.
scenes.subtext: More buyers chase the same amount of goods.
Fuel, logistics, rent, and wages all feed final prices.
Companies increase prices to stay profitable.
If everyone expects inflation, prices move preemptively.
Easier credit increases spending power in the short run.
War, weather, and disruptions raise scarcity risk.
Few dominant players can pass costs more aggressively.
Rate changes and reforms take time to work.
People downshift brands and delay non-essential purchases.
Supply scales, demand cools, and inflation normalizes.

scenes.text: Understand the system, not just the symptom.
